intro: Icacorea hamiltonii, commonly known as the Hamilton's icacorea, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. It has simple, opposite leaves and is often found in scrub or shrubland habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
